intro: Aeollanthus usambarensis, commonly known as the Usambara lily, is a flowering plant native to the Usambara Mountains in Tanzania. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats and has adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native region. It features strap-shaped leaves and produces large, white or pale pink flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
